subject: Travel
title: The Dead Sea Scrolls
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Dead Sea Scrolls.

hook.text: A shepherd chasing a goat into a cave found 2,000-year-old scrolls that rewrote religious history.

buildup.text: In 1947, a Bedouin boy threw a rock into a cave near the Dead Sea and heard pottery shatter.

discovery.text: The jars contained scrolls with the oldest known copies of Hebrew Bible texts, dating to 200 BC.

twist.text: Some scrolls were sold to antique dealers for a few dollars before anyone knew their true value.

climax.text: 972 manuscripts were found in 11 caves. They transformed our understanding of ancient Judaism and early Christianity.

punchline.text: A lost goat led to the greatest manuscript find in history.

quiz.question: How were the Dead Sea Scrolls found?
options: A shepherd chasing a goat found a cave with jars
